member.name: T:R5T.Z0000.Documentation
member.summary: Common values of .NET C# built-in types, like characters, strings, integers, etc.

member.name: P:R5T.Z0000.ICharacterIndexes.Default_FirstIndex
member.summary: The default first index is zero (0).

member.name: P:R5T.Z0000.ICharacterIndexes.ASCII_LastIndex
member.summary: The default last ASCII index is 255 (covering 2 ^ 8 = 256 values from 0 to 255, inclusive).

member.name: P:R5T.Z0000.ICharacterIndexes.ASCII_Unextended_LastIndex
member.summary: The default last, unextended, ASCII index is 127 (covering 2 ^ 7 = 128 values from 0 to 127, inclusive).

member.name: T:R5T.Z0000.ICharacterNames
member.summary: Names for characters. Character name values all: * start with a lowercase letter, * words in multi-word names are dash-separated Sources: *

member.name: P:R5T.Z0000.ICharacterNames.Unknown
member.summary: There is no "unknown" character, this is just the place-holder name for any currently unnamed characters.

member.name: P:R5T.Z0000.ICharacters.Caret
member.summary: Also known as the circumflex, or up-caret.

member.name: P:R5T.Z0000.ICharacters.FormFeed
member.summary: Strangely, in Visual Studio form-feed prints as the feminine (Venus) symbol.

member.name: P:R5T.Z0000.ICharacters.NextLine
member.summary: Sometimes the next-line character is represented as ellipsis (...).

member.name: P:R5T.Z0000.ICharacters.VerticalTab
member.summary: Strangely, in Visual Studio form-feed prints as the masculine (Mars) symbol.

member.name: P:R5T.Z0000.ICharacters.Ash_Uppercase
member.summary: A latin ligature of 'A' and 'E', or the Old English ash, which is the sound in "hat" or "pattern" (as opposed to the sound in "father" or "car").
